job_title: Director of Admissions in Philadelphia, PA
pros: People are so kind and mission focused.
kind, concerned for students beautiful campus, collegial colleagues
cons: The pay is awful - not only no raises in the time I have been there but a pay cut due to COVID that has still not been fully rectify. Only after taking the position did I learn from others that there have not been any raises at all for many years. My expenses are going up with no end in sight.

job_title: Communications/Marketing Assistant Student Worker in Philadelphia, MS
pros: Very nice coworkers and lots of freedom in the work
cons: Would've appreciated some more structure and involvement in campaigns

pros: Nothing was pretty bad, but students were great
cons: Lot of turnover, expect to meet someone one day and the next they are gone

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Bryn Mawr, PA
cons: Low pay and some poor moral

pros:
This is a real community! Employees are invested in the Mission and the Sisters of Saint Joseph infuse the campus will hospitality and genuine care for students and employees.   Management is transparent and communicates well with employees.
Employees work together no matter the department - for the good of the students!
cons: Pay is not great; however benefits are outstanding.

pros: Administration supports employees. Everyone works well together. The environment and commitment to education and helping students is to be commended. Instructors are supportive of students
cons: More opportunity for part time staff to meet

pros: Small college with overall good faculty.
cons: Micro-managers at all levels of administration.  No clear direction in the leadership.

pros: Good colleagues, beautiful campus, supportive department
cons: Low salary, too much administrative input
